styles.name: sphinx
styles.description: Sphinx (reStructuredText) style docstrings using field list syntax with colons. The most common style for Python documentation generation with Sphinx.

markers.name: param
markers.description: Documents a function parameter by name

markers.name: type
markers.description: Specifies the type of a parameter

markers.name: return
markers.description: Documents the return value

markers.name: rtype
markers.description: Specifies the return type

markers.name: raises
markers.description: Documents exceptions that may be raised

styles.template_code:
def my_function(name, age):
    """
    This is a brief description of the function.

    :param name: The name of the user.
    :type name: str
    :param age: The age of the user.
    :type age: int
    :return: A greeting message.
    :rtype: str
    """
    return f"Hello {name}, you are {age} years old."
rules: Summary Line: Start with a concise, capitalized summary of the object's purpose ending in a period.
Structural Spacing: Insert a blank line between the summary and the technical metadata/field lists.
Field Indentation: Ensure all descriptions and sub-elements are consistently indented under their respective tags.
Clean Termination: Place the closing triple-quotes on their own line to clearly demarcate the end of the block.

styles.name: google
styles.description: Google style docstrings using section headers with indented content. Popular for its readability and clean structure.

markers.name: Args
markers.description: Section header for function arguments

markers.name: Returns
markers.description: Section header for return value documentation

markers.name: Raises
markers.description: Section header for exceptions documentation

markers.name: Yields
markers.description: Section header for generator yield documentation

markers.name: Examples
markers.description: Section header for usage examples

styles.template_code:
def my_function(name, age):
    """
    This is the module or function description.

    Args:
        name (str): The name of the user.
        age (int): The age of the user.

    Returns:
        str: A greeting message.
    """
    return f"Hello {name}, you are {age} years old."
rules: Summary Line: Start with a concise, capitalized summary of the object's purpose ending in a period.
Structural Spacing: Insert a blank line between the summary and the technical metadata/field lists.
Field Indentation: Ensure all descriptions and sub-elements are consistently indented under their respective tags.
Clean Termination: Place the closing triple-quotes on their own line to clearly demarcate the end of the block.

styles.name: numpy
styles.description: NumPy style docstrings using section headers with dashed underlines. Common in scientific Python libraries.

markers.name: Parameters
markers.description: Section header for function parameters with dashed separator

markers.name: Returns
markers.description: Section header for return value with dashed separator

markers.name: Raises
markers.description: Section header for exceptions with dashed separator

markers.name: See Also
markers.description: Section header for related functions

markers.name: Examples
markers.description: Section header for usage examples

styles.template_code:
def my_function(name, age):
    """
    Brief description.

    Parameters
    ----------
    name : str
        The name of the user.
    age : int
        The age of the user.

    Returns
    -------
    str
        A greeting message.
    """
rules: Summary Line: Start with a concise, capitalized summary of the object's purpose ending in a period.
Structural Spacing: Insert a blank line between the summary and the technical metadata/field lists.
Field Indentation: Ensure all descriptions and sub-elements are consistently indented under their respective tags.
Clean Termination: Place the closing triple-quotes on their own line to clearly demarcate the end of the block.

styles.name: epytext
styles.description: Epytext style docstrings using @ symbols similar to Javadoc. Historically used by Epydoc documentation generator.

markers.name: param
markers.description: Documents a function parameter by name

markers.name: type
markers.description: Specifies the type of a parameter

markers.name: return
markers.description: Documents the return value

markers.name: rtype
markers.description: Specifies the return type

markers.name: raise
markers.description: Documents exceptions that may be raised

rules: Summary Line: Start with a concise, capitalized summary of the object's purpose ending in a period.
Structural Spacing: Insert a blank line between the summary and the technical metadata/field lists.
Field Indentation: Ensure all descriptions and sub-elements are consistently indented under their respective tags.
Clean Termination: Place the closing triple-quotes on their own line to clearly demarcate the end of the block.

styles.name: pep257
styles.description: PEP 257 minimal style docstrings. The bare-minimum Python standard, typically used for simple functions or modules.
styles.template_code:
def my_function():
    """
    Perform a simple task and return None.

    This multi-line section expands on the summary above if
    more context is required for the developer.
    """
    pass
rules: Summary Line: Start with a concise, capitalized summary of the object's purpose ending in a period.
Structural Spacing: Insert a blank line between the summary and the technical metadata/field lists.
Field Indentation: Ensure all descriptions and sub-elements are consistently indented under their respective tags.
Clean Termination: Place the closing triple-quotes on their own line to clearly demarcate the end of the block.
